properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 8 at 12:36AM PST until January 8 at 1:52PM PST by NWS Seattle WA
properties.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in
Washington...

Skookumchuck River Near Bucoda affecting Thurston County
Chehalis River Above Grand Mound affecting Grays Harbor and Thurston
Counties
Chehalis River At Porter affecting Grays Harbor County

A cold front moved east of the area Tuesday evening. Precipitation
rates decreased significantly behind the front. Snow levels have
lowered down to around 3000 feet and will continue to lower today.
The lower reaches of the Chehalis river will crest later today
into Thursday. The Skookumchuck near Bucoda will continue to recede
today.

The Flood Warning continues for
The Skookumchuck River Near Bucoda
* Until this afternoon.
* At 11:45 PM Tuesday the stage was 212.4 feet.
* Flood stage is 211.5 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river crested at 212.9 feet at 5 PM Tuesday and will
continue to fall to below flood stage early this morning.
* Impact...At 211.5 feet, the Skookumchuck River in Thurston County
will flood a few roads and low pasture lands near Bucoda.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive cars...vans...or trucks through flooded areas...this is
the cause of most flood related deaths in Washington. Be alert for
rapid changes and monitor developments by listening to NOAA Weather
radio or other local media.
